trans-unit.source: Provides a base class for elements that apply effects onto or around a single child element, such as <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox"></xref>.
A Decorator contains a single <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>, which is specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> property.
The Decorator affects, or decorates, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
The Decorator may or may not have an appearance.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border> puts a rectangle around a control, but a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> has no visual presence.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref> class.
Arranges the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref> element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> this element uses to arrange its child content.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the arranged size of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref> element and its child.
Gets or sets the single child element of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator> enforces a strong content model for child content.
The Child property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator> must be a single <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
The single child element of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref>.
Gets the child element at the specified index position.
Because <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.Child%2A> can equal only 0 or 1, specifying an `index` position greater than 1 or less than 0 results in an <xref:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException>.
Index position of the child element.
The child element at the specified index position.
index is greater than the number of visual child elements.
Gets an enumerator that can be used to iterate the logical child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref>.
An enumerator that can be used to iterate the logical child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref>.
Measures the child element of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref> to prepare for arranging it during the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator.ArrangeOverride*> pass.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator> determines its desired size by analyzing its child element's sizing properties, margin, and requested size.
An upper limit <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that should not be exceeded.
The target <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the element.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
Gets a value that is equal to the number of visual child elements of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Decorator"></xref>.
Because a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Decorator> can have only one child object in its child collection, this property always reports 0 or 1.
The number of visual child elements.
